German[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈvɛtɐ/
  • audio (Germany)
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)

Etymology 1[edit]

From Middle High German weter, from Old High German wetar, from Proto-Germanic *wedrą, from Proto-Indo-European *wedʰrom (=*we-dʰrom), from *h₂weh₁- (“to blow”). Compare Low German Weder, Dutch weer, English weather, Danish vejr.

Noun[edit]

Wetter n (genitive Wetters, plural Wetter, diminutive Wetterchen n)

  1. weather
  2. storm
